metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16912 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The "get_pipe()" function (drivers/usb/usbip/stub_rx.c) in the Linux Kernel before version 4.14.8, 4.9.71, and 4.4.114 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read) via a specially crafted USB over IP packet. It was discovered that the USB over IP implementation in the Linux kernel did not validate endpoint numbers. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16912` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-lowlatency - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-3.13.0-157-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-157.207
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-157-generic - 3.13.0-157.207
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1016-aws - 4.4.0-1016.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-157.207').
